name: GetNewsletterMetrics
description:
Retrieve metrics for a specific newsletter over time.

This tool retrieves a list of metrics for an individual newsletter over specified time intervals, such as days or weeks, presented from oldest to newest. It is useful to analyze the performance of newsletters over time, requiring at least two time steps for valid data retrieval.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the specific newsletter to retrieve metrics for. Expected to be an integer.

parameters.name: time_period_unit
parameters.description: The unit of time to report metrics (options: hours, days, weeks, months).

value_schema.description: The unit of time for your report.

parameters.name: number_of_time_periods
parameters.description: The number of time periods to return metrics for. Minimum is 2. Defaults to max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, 121 months. Use this to specify the time span for newsletter metrics.

value_schema.description: The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: Specify the type of item to return metrics for, such as 'email', 'webhook', 'twilio', etc. If not provided, metrics for all types are returned.

value_schema.description: The type of item you want to return metrics for. When empty, the response contains metrics for all possible types.
